Segment.name: G23
Segment.comment: To specify the terms of sale

Field.name: TermsTypeCode
Field.comment: Code identifying type of payment terms

Field.name: TermsBasisDateCode
Field.comment: Code identifying the beginning of the terms period

Field.name: TermsStartDate
Field.comment: Date from which payment terms are calculated expressed in format CCYYMMDD where CC represents the first two digits of the calendar year

Field.name: TermsDueDateQualifier
Field.comment: Code identifying the method to be used for payment in conjunction with due date

Field.name: TermsDiscountPercent
Field.comment: Terms discount percentage, expressed as a percent, available to the purchaser if an invoice is paid on or before the Terms Discount Due Date

Field.name: TermsDiscountDueDate
Field.comment: Date payment is due if discount is to be earned expressed in format CCYYMMDD where CC represents the first two digits of the calendar year

Field.name: TermsDiscountDaysDue
Field.comment: Number of days in the terms discount period by which payment is due if terms discount is earned

Field.name: TermsNetDueDate
Field.comment: Date when total invoice amount becomes due expressed in format CCYYMMDD where CC represents the first two digits of the calendar year

Field.name: TermsNetDays
Field.comment: Number of days until total invoice amount is due (discount not applicable)

Field.name: DiscountedAmountDue
Field.comment: Amount of invoice due if paid by terms discount due date (total invoice or installment amount less cash discount)

Field.name: AmountSubjectToTermsDiscount
Field.comment: Amount upon which the terms discount amount is calculated

Field.name: InstallmentTotalInvoiceAmountDue
Field.comment: Deferred or installment portion of the total invoice (including charges, less allowances) before terms discount (if discount is applicable)

Field.name: PercentOfInvoicePayable
Field.comment: Amount of invoice payable expressed in percent

Field.name: InstallmentGroupIndicator
Field.comment: The installment group indicator is a 2-digit serial number beginning with 01 (i.e., 01, 02, 03 or 04); it is used to group "elective" terms types in an installment payment situation; the same indicator must be used for all segments in the same installment
